intro: Limeum deserticola, commonly known as the desert lime, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, with thick leaves and a deep root system to conserve water. Limeum deserticola is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
